metadata.title: CVE-2024-6923 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a MEDIUM severity vulnerability affecting CPython.Theemail module didnâ€™t properly quote newlines for email headers whenserializing an email message allowing for header injection when an email is serialized.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.6+esm21').
python3.4 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
